scenarioDescription:
The MOA-2010-BLG-477L Exoplanetary System


Overview

MOA-2010-BLG-477L is a star with 0.67 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 7501.59 light years away from the solar system.

MOA-2010-BLG-477L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the MOA-2010-BLG-477L system


MOA-2010-BLG-477L b

MOA-2010-BLG-477L b was discovered by the MOA observatory, in 2012-07, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 2.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of MOA-2010-BLG-477L b is 477.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of MOA-2010-BLG-477L b is 13.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, MOA-2010-BLG-477L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system MOA-2010-BLG-477L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the MOA.
name: MOA-2010-BLG-477L - System With 1 Exoplanet
